BC StageTimingPrefixCS CodeSystem

When staging was done, relative to treatment events (qualifier).

name: StageTimingPrefixCS
title: BC StageTimingPrefixCS CodeSystem
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: When staging was done, relative to treatment events (qualifier).

concept.definition: Clinical stage: Staging performed prior to surgery, based on evidence such as physical examination, imaging, and/or biopsy.
concept.display: Clinical stage: Staging performed prior to surgery, based on evidence such as physical examination, imaging, and/or biopsy.

concept.definition: Pathologic stage: Staging performed based on examination of tissue samples removed during surgery, in addition to physical examination and imaging.
concept.display: Pathologic stage: Staging performed based on examination of tissue samples removed during surgery, in addition to physical examination and imaging.

concept.definition: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) clinical staging based on clinical examination after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation, when no surgery has been performed.
concept.display: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) clinical staging based on clinical examination after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation, when no surgery has been performed.

concept.definition: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) pathologic staging, based  on tissue samples removed during surgery after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation.
concept.display: Post-therapeutic (post-neoadjuvant) pathologic staging, based  on tissue samples removed during surgery after the first treatment with systemic drugs or radiation.
